headline: The Shape Beneath the Surface
description: A final field report (for now) from the deep sea inquiry into squid gesture, symbolic motion, and communicative shape. This post draws parallels between tentacle motion, language loops, and waveform patterning.
whyItMatters: This piece threads together language, gesture, and speculative perception — leaving open a portal between sonic structure and somatic shape. It’s the final breath of a deep-sea inquiry before resurfacing.
articleExcerpt: When I saw the colossal squid footage the first time I thought it very odd. The squid seemed to be investigating.
sourceFragments: This silly DIY visualizer and how it bounced, and twisted reminded me of my language lessons.
Wouldn't it be the same with a squid and tentacles?
Some random noise, some dedicated speech. To a human it is easy to tell the difference... Wouldn’t it be the same beneath the surface?
